channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Dr. Katharine Hayhoe
item.description: On Monday, I wrote an essay about climate and biodiversity for Scientific American. I tracked proportional engagement, calculated as (likes + shares + comments)/followers, over six social media platforms.The winner? MASTODON, by a landslide.Second place? INSTAGRAM. It's harder to share posts on IG, but lot of people like things there!The loser? FACEBOOK, also by a landslide.* * On Facebook, I've been shadow-banned since August 2018 when they listed clean energy and climate as "socially sensitive topics" so my page there stopped growing 6 years ago and now only about 1% of my followers there ever see my posts if the mention climate. It's actually too bad, because that's the platform where I reach the most conservative audiences through their connections to friends and family. So even though it's dead last, I still persist.** For example, I had a post on FB a few weeks ago that didn't mention climate or clean energy. Its engagement levels were 3.7% which would put it just below Instagram.

item.title: Danny Boling üåà ‚òÆÔ∏è
item.description:
DO NOT BUY HP PRINTERS! I don't believe I've ever seen a more #dastardly #plan from a #hardware #manufacturer. If you buy an #HP #printer and sign up for the optional HP Plus #service, you'll get a #firmware #update that will FORCE you to #purchase *only* new HP #ink cartridges ‚Äî for the life of your printer. And once that firmware update happens, there is *no way* to undo it. DO NOT BUY HP PRINTERS! https://www.theverge.com/2023/5/25/23736811/hp-plus-printer-ink-drm-firmware-update-cant-cancel
HP has found an exciting new way to #DRM your printer #IAmDB

item.title: Benjamin Carr, Ph.D. üë®üèª‚Äçüíªüß¨
item.description:
#VirginiaNorwood passed away earlier this year at the age of 96, and #NASA‚Äôs farewell to this influential pioneer is a worth a read. Virginia was a brilliant #physicist and #engineer, and among her other accomplishments, we have her to thank for the ongoing success of the #Landsat program, which continues to this day. The goal of the program was to image land from #space for the purpose of resource management.
https://hackaday.com/2023/05/13/remembering-virginia-norwood-mother-of-nasas-landsat-success/

item.title: NPR :press:
item.description: Republican-led Texas House impeaches state Attorney General Ken PaxtonTexas Attorney General Ken Paxton has been impeached by fellow Republicans in a historic vote in the Texas House. He will immediately and temporarily be suspended from his duties. #presshttps://www.npr.org/2023/05/27/1178606035/ken-paxton-impeachment-texas-house-republican-attorney-general-investigation?utm_medium=JSONFeed&utm_campaign=news&utm_source=press.coop

item.title: Daniel Lakens
item.description: Page where John Venn (1866) first describes the 'sharpshooter fallacy', or drawing the target *after* making the shot. Of course, the sharpshooter might still be a good shot - but nothing has been done to severely test they are not.

item.title: Jon Worth
item.description: And really the sheer absurdity of European SleeperHere are two determined guys. They lease a freight locomotive, 2 ancient sleeping cars (at least with air con), 6 couchettes without air con (also old) and 2 seating carriagesAnd they manage to run a Berlin-Brussels night train, something that others - like DB, NS or SNCB - could *much more easily do with their financial means* BUT REFUSE TO EVEN TRYAnd basic though it is it‚Äôs booked up all summer
